import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import tensorflow.keras as keras
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

train = pd.read_csv("../input/petfinder-pawpularity-score/train.csv")

def show(img_id):
    img = keras.preprocessing.image.load_img(f"{IMG_DIR}/{img_id}.jpg") 
    plt.imshow(img)
    plt.axis('off')
    plt.show()
source.3df5f61d:
# Explore how they look

See a sample of Pawpular (>=90) and not-so-pawpular (<=10) pets... do you find significant differences between them? *I don't!*

Maybe sometimes the quality of the photo (composition, wide-angle closeups, lighting, etc) and probably puppies and kittens are favored but, to me, it's hard to say...

**How well a human baseline would do on this dataset?**
